head.title: Times Executive Gets Newly Created Job

hedline.hl1: Times Executive Gets Newly Created Job

abstract.p: New York Times Co announces appointment of Charles E Shelton to new position of vice president for work force development in human resources department; photo (S)

block.p: The New York Times Company announced yesterday that Charles E. Shelton had been appointed to the new position of vice president for work force development in the human resources department.
Mr. Shelton, 52, will oversee the company's diversity, management development and management performance programs. He will report to Cynthia H. Augustine, senior vice president for human resources.
The New York Times Company announced yesterday that Charles E. Shelton had been appointed to the new position of vice president for work force development in the human resources department.
Mr. Shelton, 52, will oversee the company's diversity, management development and management performance programs. He will report to Cynthia H. Augustine, senior vice president for human resources.
Mr. Shelton joined The Times in 1967 and has held jobs in sales, budget analysis and circulation. Since August 1995, he has been vice president for distribution.
